why_low_match_rate: USS historical data only covers 59 competitions (mostly national/regional championships)
STL includes many local/regional events not tracked in USS (Capitol City, Gateway, Great Lakes Heartland series, etc.)
USS results are per-distance/race; STL aggregates to 'best_rank' at event level - comparing different metrics
Event name matching across years (103rd vs 104th Silver Skates) causes false matches
USS data lacks age category separation - a Junior D skater's result gets compared to open/senior category results
STL has events from 2024-2026 which USS historical (2017-2023) cannot validate
analysis.data_quality_assessment: STL data appears internally consistent. Low USS match rate is due to scope differences, not data quality issues.
analysis.recommendation: Validate using uss_all_results.json when available (includes 2024+ events with age categories)

category_insights.junior_a_b_highest_match: Older juniors (A/B) have higher USS match rates (31-36%) - they compete in more USS-tracked events
category_insights.junior_f_g_lowest_match: Youngest skaters (F/G) rarely appear in USS data - compete primarily in local events

sample_mismatches_explained.explanation: USS shows different year's 103rd Silver Skates; STL rank is age-group specific, USS is open category
Different distances/races - STL best_rank vs USS individual race result

validation_methodology.name_normalization: STL 'LAST First' converted to 'first last' for matching
validation_methodology.competition_matching: Fuzzy matching on competition names with 0.3 similarity threshold
validation_methodology.year_tolerance: Events must be within 1 year to match
validation_methodology.rank_comparison: STL best_rank vs USS place (different metrics - event-level vs race-level)

conclusions: 24.1% of STL youth skaters have at least one result in USS historical data
Most non-matches are due to scope differences, not data errors
STL data appears accurate for the events it covers
Full validation requires USS data with: (a) age categories, (b) 2024+ events, (c) local/regional events
